title: Strengthening Programming Practical Skills: Discourse-Based Probability and Statistics Conceptual and Procedural Understanding Curriculum

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental arithmetic operations and graph interpretation skills
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for IT/Software Development Professionals

learning_goals: At the experiment’s conclusion, learners explain probability distribution concepts through verbal/nonverbal discourse with 80% or higher accuracy.
Learners successfully analyze three or more real-world cases by applying statistical reasoning procedures to teamwork-based problem-solving activities.
Learners present decision-making rationales reflecting probabilistic thinking in project deliverables using two or more visualization techniques.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
